abstract: This paper studies codes that correct a burst of deletions or insertions. Namely, a code will be called a b-burstdeletion/ insertion-correcting code if it can correct a burst of deletions/ insertions of any b consecutive bits. While the lower bound on the redundancy of such codes was shown by Levenshtein to be asymptotically log(n)+b�1, the redundancy of the best code construction by Cheng et al. is b(log(n=b + 1)). In this paper, we close on this gap and provide codes with redundancy at most log(n) + (b � 1) log(log(n)) + b � log(b). We first show that the models of insertions and deletions are equivalent and thus it is enough to study codes correcting a burst of deletions. We then derive a non-asymptotic upper bound on the size of b-burst-deletion-correcting codes and extend the burst deletion model to two more cases: 1) A deletion burst of at most b consecutive bits and 2) A deletion burst of size at most b (not necessarily consecutive). We extend our code construction for the first case and study the second case for b = 3; 4.
